suwo 0.1.0
  • Reference

    Access 'wikiaves' recordings and metadata

    query_wikiaves.Rd

    query_wikiaves searches for metadata from wikiaves.

    query_wikiaves(term, type, cores = 1, pb = TRUE, verbose = TRUE, all_data = TRUE)

    Arguments

    term

    Character vector of length one indicating species, to query 'wikiaves' database. For example, Phaethornis longirostris.

    type

    Character vector with media type to query for. Options are 'still image' or 'sound'. Required.

    cores

    Numeric. Controls whether parallel computing is applied. It specifies the number of cores to be used. Default is 1 (i.e. no parallel computing).

    pb

    Logical argument to control progress bar. Default is TRUE.

    verbose

    Logical argument that determines if text is shown in console. Default is TRUE.

    all_data

    Logical argument that determines if all data available from database is shown in the results of search. Default is TRUE.

    Value

    If all_data is not provided the function returns a data frame with the following recording information: recording ID, media type, user ID, species ID, scientific name, common name, repository ID, author, user name, date, verified condition, location, location ID, comments, likes, visualizations, url, duration and repository

    Details

    This function queries for avian vocalization recordings in the open-access online repository wikiaves. It can return recordings metadata.

    References

    Schubert, Stephanie Caroline, Lilian Tonelli Manica, and André De Camargo Guaraldo. 2019. Revealing the potential of a huge citizen-science platform to study bird migration. Emu-Austral Ornithology 119.4: 364-373.

    Author

    Marcelo Araya-Salas (marcelo.araya@ucr.ac.cr)

    Examples

    if (FALSE) {
# search
df1 <- query_wikiaves(term = 'Phaethornis nattereri', type = "still image")
View(df1)

}
